title: Stream: Alden Penner – Precession EP
body:
Just as I thought all had gone quiet from the elusive Canadian, Alden Penner has released a magical new EP with the promise of a new album and tour dates in the new year.

Precession draws influences from a ton of Alden’s previous projects. Tracks combine the orchestral genius of [Clues](http://cstrecords.com/clues/) with the classical guitar of [The Hidden Words](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/4776-new-the-hidden-words-track-preview/), all with a dash of [Unicornesque](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rrie4px3zXg) lo-fi thrown in. Alden’s stand out lyrics and hermaphroditic vocals reign supreme with their ethereal quality adding to the EP’s spiritual feeling.

Stream Precession in its entirety below or pick up a digital copy over at [bandcamp](http://aldenpennersongs.bandcamp.com/).

Just as [The Hidden Words](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/4776-new-the-hidden-words-track-preview/) was a direct reference and tribute to the sacred texts of the Bahá’í Faith (of which Alden is believed to be a follower), it seems Precession refers to the Bahá’í Faith’s solar calendar. The precession of the equinox is an astrological observation of the Earth’s axis rotating like a spinning top in a 25,700 year cycle. Pretty sure there’s a ton more to it than that but:

A. I HAVE NO IDEA WHAT I’M TALKING ABOUT

B. This is a blog post not a sermon

Perhaps someone can fill us in using the comment box below.
